CodeClear.​NaturalDocs.​Engine.​Config.​Manager
CodeClear.​NaturalDocs.​Engine.​Module
public
CodeClear.​NaturalDocs.​Engine.​Config.​Manager

A class to manage the engine's configuration.

Usage

  • Create a ProjectInfo object with the command line configuration.  At minimum the project config folder must be set.

  • Call Engine.Instance.Start(), which will start this module.

  • After the engine has been called all the properties are read-only.

  • All modules MUST check ReparseEverything before loading their own working data files and not bother if it's set.

Functions
Manager
static Manager ()
Manager
public Manager (
Engine.Instance engineInstance
)
Dispose
protected override void Dispose (
bool strictRulesApply

Start
public bool Start (
ErrorList errorList,
ProjectConfig commandLineConfig
)

Initializes the configuration and returns whether all the settings are correct and that execution is ready to begin.  If there are problems they are added as Errors to the errorList parameter.  This class is not designed to allow multiple attempts.  If this function fails scrap the entire Engine.Instance and start again.

After Start() is called the properties of this class become read-only.  This function will add all the input and filter targets it has to Files.Manager, and all output targets to Output.Manager.

MergeConfig
public static void MergeConfig (
ProjectConfig primaryConfig,
ProjectConfig secondaryConfig
)

Merges the settings of the secondary configuration into the primary one.  The primary configuration will only adopt the secondary settings which it does not already have set.  When merging you should start with your most important configuration and merge others into it in order of importance.

If the primary config has input targets, only unset properties from matching targets in the secondary config will be copied.  Any targets not appearing in the primary config will be ignored.  If there are no input targets in the primary config, they will be copied from the secondary config.

This system also applies for output and filter targets, with the exception of filter targets from a Source.SystemDefault config.  Filters found in a Source.SystemDefault config will always be added to the primary config.

MergeProjectInfo
protected static void MergeProjectInfo (
ProjectInfo primaryProjectInfo,
ProjectInfo secondaryProjectInfo
)

Merges the settings of the secondary ProjectInfo into the primary one.  The primary ProjectInfo will only adopt the secondary settings which it does not already have set.  When merging you should start with your most important configuration and merge others into it in order of importance.

MergeInputTargets
protected static void MergeInputTargets (
Targets.InputBase primaryTarget,
Targets.InputBase secondaryTarget
)

Merges the settings of the secondary input target into the primary one.  The primary target will only adopt the secondary settings which it does not already have set.  When merging you should start with your most important target and merge others into it in order of importance.

It is assumed that the two targets are of the same class and match with Targets.InputBase.IsSameTarget().

MergeOutputTargets
protected static void MergeOutputTargets (
Targets.OutputBase primaryTarget,
Targets.OutputBase secondaryTarget
)

Merges the settings of the secondary output target into the primary one.  The primary target will only adopt the secondary settings which it does not already have set.  When merging you should start with your most important target and merge others into it in order of importance.

It is assumed that the two targets are of the same class and match with Targets.OutputBase.IsSameTarget().

Targets.InputBase target

Creates and returns a Files.FileSource from the passed input target config.

CreateFilter

Targets.FilterBase target

Creates and returns a Files.Filter from the passed target config.

CreateOutputFilter
protected virtual Files.Filter CreateOutputFilter (
Targets.OutputBase target
)

Creates and returns a Files.Filter from the passed output target so that the target's files are excluded from being scanned with the source, or null if one isn't needed.

CreateBuilder
protected virtual Output.Builder CreateBuilder (
Targets.OutputBase target
)

Creates and returns an Output.Builder from the passed target config.

Properties
ProjectConfigFolder
public Path ProjectConfigFolder { get }

The project configuration folder's absolute Path, formerly called the project folder.  This must be defined before Start() will succeed.  If it is set to a relative path, it will be converted to absolute with the current working folder.  Once Start() is called it cannot be changed.

SystemConfigFolder
public Path SystemConfigFolder { get }

The system configuration folder's absolute Path.

SystemStyleFolder
public Path SystemStyleFolder { get }

The system style folder's absolute Path.  All styles will be subfolders of this one.

WorkingDataFolder
public Path WorkingDataFolder { get }

The working data folder's absolute Path.  Optional to set.  Once Start() is called it cannot be changed.

ReparseEverything
public bool ReparseEverything { get; set }

If set, all source files are going to be reparsed.  Modules MUST check this and rebuild their data files from scratch if it's set.  This is important because this gets set if certain data files are corrupted (such as Languages.nd) and thus various numeric IDs are not guaranteed to mean the same thing they did on the last run.

It is only possible to change this property to true.  You cannot turn it off once it's on.

RebuildAllOutput
public bool RebuildAllOutput { get; set }

If set, all output is going to be regenerated.

It is only possible to change this property to true.  You cannot turn it off once it's on.

TabWidth
public int TabWidth { get }

The number of spaces a tab character should be expanded to.

DocumentedOnly
public bool DocumentedOnly { get }

Whether only documented code elements should appear in the output.

AutoGroup
public bool AutoGroup { get }

Whether automatic grouping should be applied.

ShrinkFiles
public bool ShrinkFiles { get }

Whether whitespace and comments should be removed from CSS and JavaScript files in the output.

OutputWorkingDataFileOf
public Path OutputWorkingDataFileOf (
int number
)

Returns the working data file path for the passed output entry number.  It's up to the output entry whether it wants to actually create and use a file at this path, this just makes sure it has its own unique path.

OutputWorkingDataFolderOf
public Path OutputWorkingDataFolderOf (
int number
)

Returns the working data folder path for the passed output entry number.  It's up to the output entry whether it wants to actually create and use files in this folder, this just makes sure it has its own unique path.

static public ProjectConfig SystemDefaultConfig { get }

The system defaults that should be combined with user ProjectConfigs.

UsingUnix

True if the program is running in Unix.

The path separator character for the current platform, such as slash or backslash.

Whether paths are case sensitive on the current platform.

KeySettingsForPaths

The Collections.KeySettings that should be used when using paths as a key.
